intro: Dissotidendron johnstonianum, commonly known as Johnston's dissotidendron, is a rare and ancient plant species native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique morphology, including its spiral arrangement of leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant exhibits a climbing habit, often using its tendrils to support itself among dense vegetation. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
